column4: Should I try to Install WIne to get my Tv Tuner to work. I mean is it possible to get some devices to work like that?
Tuner card is techCom internal but not sure of the name
I have that chipset on my MSI TV@nywhere Plus
You got it to work>\????
Ive tried TvTime, Mythtv, scantv,xawtv
watching it now....what kind of issues are you having?
Well I couldnt get video
I tried various numbers and got video on modprobe saa7134 card=3 tuner=69 but no audio
I have a cable running from my tuner to my sound card also
But cant get sound :(
ok.....I ran into that with xawtv in Kubuntu.......I think that's exactly they way I had mine setup.....let me look and see how it's setup on this distro....
Ive posted this here at http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=599181
yep....card=3 tuner=69 on this distro too
of course I didn't have to do anything to make it work this time....
I dont know why I cant get audio, Ive checkd in my audio preference and I dont have a capture tab anywhere, And I have gone into preferences and selected everythign in there
by default your tv card should have it's audio on......in your sound prefs under input you might try selecting mic and line in and turn both up
assuming your's is setup like mine you just have a cable running into either mic or line or aux.....?
Did that but I still cant get it to play audio :(
Into Line in of my audio card
well its onboard Asus M2n MX SE
sorry man......if you download what I mentioned in my privmsg and run it you might see how it works that way. Might help to make it work under *buntu
Thanks will check it out
